alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 8:46PM CDT until May 02 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. .Flooding on the Sheyenne will begin to diminish overnight tonight. The river will cross below flood stage tomorrow. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River at Harwood. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 84.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. Actions taken to completely seal the flood barrier. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 84.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM CDT Sunday was 84.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 84.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
